column4: [17179574.392000]  Kernal panic - not syncing :VFS :unable to mount root fs on unknow - block (0,0)
how do i solve this ?

I recently changed the grub menu order , after chaging im getting this error and cant boot my 27 kernel linux ... only 26 and down  The Problem states : [17179574.392000]  Kernal panic - not syncing :VFS :unable to mount root fs on unknow - block (0,0)
what drive is linux installed on?  Might be trying to boot from the wrong partition
then set the entry to the right one ;-)
boot from a live CD or in another kernel and check the hd() setting for that entry
the hd() setting should match your other kernels
in menu.lst copy the lines from the working kernels
you said a 26 works, just look at the line for that one
the difference will be the name of the kernel and initrd, so make those match the 27
any luck?
I was wrong before btw, wasabi_ was right
it's the line for   root   that probably doesn't match
weird
did you mess around with your actual kernel or initrd files, also did you boot 27 before the changes?
I'm not sure what to tell you now, can you paste your menu.lst to the pastebin site?
boot one of the working kernels and do it
yeah seeing your file would be helpful for sure
yes
k
pastebin your changed file
somewhat
don't just ask me though, ask generally
